title: Display Serif
content:
Hey everyone,  
I’m looking for some new or interesting display serif fonts for editorial (mens magazine). I have been using Freight display and looking to try out something new. I love the simplicity of freight and cheltenham, and perhaps there are some new ones people have in the works or could suggest? Many thanks! Also, one with a lovely italic set would be fantastic!

thanks,  
nick

comments.content: I keep coming back to Jean François Porchez’s Ambroise. Anyone used it?

Blatant self-promotion [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081204120620/http:/www.creativepro.com/blog/font-fetish-anticipation-aka-benton-modern-display). You only see one style here but there are lovely italics to match.

Blatant self-promotion here: [http://www.kentlew.com/WhitmDisOverview.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081204120620/http:/www.kentlew.com/WhitmDisOverview.html "http://www.kentlew.com/WhitmDisOverview.html").

PDF here: [http://www.kentlew.com/Type/WhitmanDisplay\_Sample.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20081204120620/http:/www.kentlew.com/Type/WhitmanDisplay_Sample.pdf "http://www.kentlew.com/Type/WhitmanDisplay\_Sample.pdf")

You can see some of these styles currently in use in <cite>Fortune</cite> magazine (including the Whitman Display Italics not yet shown on the website or in the pdf). Available through the Font Bureau Studio library; scheduled for Retail release in the very near future.

Don’t know if this fits your bill or not.

— K.
